Html.content:
It follows an overview of importent classes exposed by the API. To get more detailed information, use the JavaDoc for the classes.

  • org.opencms.jsp.util.CmsJspStandardContextBean

An instance of this bean is present in each OpenCms managed JSP as EL variable cms and is indented to be used from a JSP with the JSTL or EL. It provides access to several other beans like for instance the org.opencms.file.CmsRequestContext by calling cms.requestContext.

  • org.opencms.jsp.CmsJspActionElement

This bean is useful if scriptlet code is required. It provides direct access to the functionality offered by the OpenCms taglib.

  • org.opencms.file.CmsRequestContext

It stores the information about the current users OpenCms context, for example the requested URI, the current project, the selected site and more. It provides environment information for handling the current request

  • org.opencms.file.CmsObject

This bean acts as facade to provide all externally available functions of OpenCms. It encapsulates user identification and permissions. It could beThought of as an initialized shell to access the OpenCms VFS. Every call to a method here will be checked for user permissions according to the CmsRequestContext this CmsObject instance was created with.

  • org.opencms.jsp.util.CmsJspVfsAccessBean

It provides utility methods that allow convenient access to the OpenCms VFS, indented to be used from a JSP with the JSTL or EL.

  • org.opencms.jsp.CmsJspBean

this class is the superclass for OpenCms JSP beans that provides convient access to OpenCms core and VFS functionality. If large chunks of code need to be available in a JSP it is suggested to move it to a class file which is a subclass of this bean. In order to work properly each instasnce must be initialized with the current page context, request and response object.
